body_html:
Edit: I installed pytorch from source instead (without pip and anaconda), which works fine. So I am happy now ;-)

Hi everyone, I have the same problem. I am on Ubuntu 16.04 and using python 3.5. I do only have an integrated Intel HD 620.
At first I tried installing pytorch with cuda 7.5 with pip3. "import torch" always resulted in segmentation fault, therefore I tried installing without cuda, which results in the same error:

sudo -H pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.3.0.post4-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
sudo -H pip3 install --no-deps torchvision

import torch
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

As suggested above, I add the gdb and ldd output below.
Any ideas how to avoid the error and get pytorch working?

(gdb) r -c "import torch"
Starting program: /usr/bin/python3 -c "import torch"
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".
[New Thread 0x7ffff3a6b700 (LWP 9551)]
[New Thread 0x7ffff326a700 (LWP 9552)]
[New Thread 0x7fffeea69700 (LWP 9553)]

Thread 1 "python3" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0 0x0000000000002260 in ?? ()
#1 0x00007ffff7de76ba in call_init (l=, argc=argc@entry=3,
argv=argv@entry=0x7fffffffd838, env=env@entry=0xbb42d0) at dl-init.c:72
#2 0x00007ffff7de77cb in call_init (env=0xbb42d0, argv=0x7fffffffd838, argc=3, l=)
at dl-init.c:30
#3 _dl_init (main_map=main_map@entry=0xfa9b50, argc=3, argv=0x7fffffffd838, env=0xbb42d0)
at dl-init.c:120
#4 0x00007ffff7dec8e2 in dl_open_worker (a=a@entry=0x7fffffffb360) at dl-open.c:575
#5 0x00007ffff7de7564 in _dl_catch_error (objname=objname@entry=0x7fffffffb350,
errstring=errstring@entry=0x7fffffffb358, mallocedp=mallocedp@entry=0x7fffffffb34f,
operate=operate@entry=0x7ffff7dec4d0 <dl_open_worker>, args=args@entry=0x7fffffffb360)
at dl-error.c:187
#6 0x00007ffff7debda9 in _dl_open (
file=0x7fffe9fe91a0 "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/_C.cpython-35m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so", mode=-2147483391, caller_dlopen=0x60b35a <_PyImport_FindSharedFuncptr+138>, nsid=-2,
argc=, argv=, env=0xbb42d0) at dl-open.c:660
#7 0x00007ffff75ecf09 in dlopen_doit (a=a@entry=0x7fffffffb590) at dlopen.c:66
#8 0x00007ffff7de7564 in _dl_catch_error (objname=0xb25650, errstring=0xb25658, mallocedp=0xb25648,
operate=0x7ffff75eceb0 <dlopen_doit>, args=0x7fffffffb590) at dl-error.c:187

args=args@entry=0x7fffffffb590) at dlerror.c:163
#10 0x00007ffff75ecfa1 in __dlopen (file=, mode=) at dlopen.c:87

Edit: I installed pytorch from source instead (without pip and anaconda), which works fine. So I am happy now ;-)
Hi everyone, I have the same problem. I am on Ubuntu 16.04 and using python 3.5. I do only have an integrated Intel HD 620.
At first I tried installing pytorch with cuda 7.5 with pip3. "import torch" always resulted in segmentation fault, therefore I tried installing without cuda, which results in the same error:
sudo -H pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.3.0.post4-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
sudo -H pip3 install --no-deps torchvision



import torch
Segmentation fault (core dumped)



As suggested above, I add the gdb and ldd output below.
Any ideas how to avoid the error and get pytorch working?

body:
Edit: I installed pytorch from source instead (without pip and anaconda), which works fine. So I am happy now ;-)

Hi everyone, I have the same problem. I am on Ubuntu 16.04 and using python 3.5. I do only have an integrated Intel HD 620.
At first I tried installing pytorch with cuda 7.5 with pip3. "import torch" always resulted in segmentation fault, therefore I tried installing without cuda, which results in the same error:

sudo -H pip3 install http://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu80/torch-0.3.0.post4-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl 
sudo -H pip3 install --no-deps torchvision
>>> import torch
Segmentation fault (core dumped)

As suggested above, I add the gdb and ldd output below.
Any ideas how to avoid the error and get pytorch working?
